- use simple quote and not double brackets to set default value
- use value '1900-01-01T00:00:00.000' as datetime default and not the function getdate() 
- not necessary to set NULL as default value for nullable field

In administrator/components/com_easysdi_service/models/policy.php, line 299, the group by statement seems to be useless and leads to an SQL Server error. Just commented it out.

In sditable.php, function check() did not properly rewrite alias field. 
Replace all the rewrite actions by the use of JApplication::stringURLSafe($this->alias).

Letting the Joomla API sqlserver driver manage the default values in queries had shown several problems :

- the use of "$this->reset()" in the load method of classes extending JTable : the object is correctly reset with the schema read from the database, but when the object is sent back to be stored, all the default values are sent as string fields (causing error for all the non string fields)

- when a field of the database schema is not define on a JTable object, before building the SQL statement, the joomla driver (driver.php, updateObject())automatically add this field and set it a NULL value causing error for non nullable fields...

To avoid those errors :
- remove all the use of reset() method in table object
- Complete the sdiTable class to fill all the mandatory fields with default values
